page.title: 06THE NEW BIELD AT LYVEDEN 2
page.content: In 1605 Sir Thomas died. His son Francis was involved in the Gunpowder Plot and died in the Tower of London. The Rushton (Rushden?) estate was fortified to the crown,but Lyveden passed on to the younger son SirLewis.For a time Lyveden belonged to the junior branch of the Treshams of Newton. The property passed into the hands of the Fitzpatrick family early in the eighteenth century. In 1922, the New Bield was presented to the National Trust, who repaired it and made it accessible to the public. To reach the Bield you have to park your car at the foot of the hill on the Benefield to Brigstock road and then walk up to the property. Tickets are bought from the cottage of the custodians who will also sell you a National Trust booklet.
